fields.summary: Add disk usage threshold to prevent disk full failure
fields.description:
Currently in our production environment, the most common problem with Kafka is disk full failure. When the failure occurs, Kafka cannot provide any services, and can only be recovered by manually deleting disk data or expanding the disk capacity and then restarting the service.

In contrast, RocketMQ and RabbitMQ already support disk threshold configuration (such as {{diskMaxUsedSpaceRatio}} , {{disk_free_limit}} ). When the disk usage exceeds the limit, the system rejects new produce, but the service remains available.

So we hope to implement a similar strategy in Kafka to prevent the disk full failure.

KIP: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP-1201%3A+Add+disk+threshold+config+to+prevent+disk+full+failure
